title.narrative: Tashkent Province Water Supply Development Project

description.narrative: The project will support the Government of Uzbekistan in the rehabilitation of a regional water supply system located in two districts of Tashkent Province. Responding directly to the needs of urban communities, it will upgrade existing water supply networks, provide potable water treatment services, build institutional capacity, and assist to strengthen the province?s water supply and wastewater utility

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved access to reliable, sustainable, and affordable water supply services in Tashkent Province (Zangiota and Kibray Districts)

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Kadirya regional water system provide 24 hours a day water supply to 58 settlements (Zangiota: 38 settlements, Kibray: 20 settlements) by 2022 (baseline 2016: 12.6 hours/day)

description.narrative: Improved access to reliable, sustainable, and affordable water supply services in Tashkent Province (Zangiota and Kibray Districts)

title.narrative: Public satisfaction with quality of water supply increased to 90% by 2022 (baseline 2016: 46%)

description.narrative: Improved access to reliable, sustainable, and affordable water supply services in Tashkent Province (Zangiota and Kibray Districts)

title.narrative: 100% of the population of 58 settlements (Zangiota: 38 settlements, Kibray: 20 settlements) connected to the Kadirya regional water supply system have access to reliable and safe water supply by 2022 (baseline 2016: 32,880 households and 159 commercial entities with irregular service)

description.narrative: Improved access to reliable, sustainable, and affordable water supply services in Tashkent Province (Zangiota and Kibray Districts)

title.narrative: Bills collection for water supply services increased to 95% by 2022 (Baseline 2016: 85%)

description.narrative: Improved access to reliable, sustainable, and affordable water supply services in Tashkent Province (Zangiota and Kibray Districts)
